comments:
When importing a Windows System log or and Apache Access log, the creation times are all displayed as zero.  Please see attached snapshot

Assigning to Dave Smith as requested by Alex
This needs to be investigated for iteration 3.
Raising severity and priority because it needs to be investigated and resolved in 4.2.

Ran GLA in standalone mode, writing CBE's to file and the creationTime values were correct. Also, with Alex's help, we saved the imported log file and examined the xmi file and it contained no creationTime values.  I'll attach this saved file.

Reassigning to Marius to investigate if this is a model problem.

Created an attachment (id=40543)
Saved imported log file agent resource
Please attach the file with CBEs generated by GLA.

On an english machine the import of example.txt XML file generated by GLA works through the Common Base Event parser, but it fails through the import profile file wizard which expects UTF-8, see the error bellow:

org.xml.sax.SAXParseException: Invalid byte 1 of 1-byte UTF-8 sequence.
	at org.apache.xerces.util.ErrorHandlerWrapper.createSAXParseException(Unknown Source)
	at org.apache.xerces.util.ErrorHandlerWrapper.fatalError(Unknown Source)
	at org.apache.xerces.impl.XMLErrorReporter.reportError(Unknown Source)
	at org.apache.xerces.impl.XMLErrorReporter.reportError(Unknown Source)
	at org.apache.xerces.impl.XMLDocumentFragmentScannerImpl$FragmentContentDispatcher.dispatch(Unknown Source)
	at org.apache.xerces.impl.XMLDocumentFragmentScannerImpl.scanDocument(Unknown Source)
	at org.apache.xerces.parsers.XML11Configuration.parse(Unknown Source)
	at org.apache.xerces.parsers.XML11Configuration.parse(Unknown Source)
	at org.apache.xerces.parsers.XMLParser.parse(Unknown Source)
	at org.apache.xerces.parsers.AbstractSAXParser.parse(Unknown Source)
	at org.apache.xerces.jaxp.SAXParserImpl$JAXPSAXParser.parse(Unknown Source)
	at org.apache.xerces.jaxp.SAXParserImpl.parse(Unknown Source)
	at org.eclipse.hyades.loaders.util.SAXFragmentHandler.parse(SAXFragmentHandler.java:128)
	at org.eclipse.hyades.loaders.util.SAXFragmentHandler.scanContent(SAXFragmentHandler.java:431)
	at org.eclipse.hyades.loaders.util.XMLLoader.loadEvents(XMLLoader.java:763)
	at org.eclipse.hyades.trace.ui.internal.wizard.ImportTracePage1$3.run(ImportTracePage1.java:894)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:58)

When I try to load the XML file (I just added the <CommonBaseEvents> root element) in Internet Explorer I get:

An invalid character was found in text content. Error processing resource 'file:///E:/test/input/logs/defects/138281/example.xml'. Line 3, Position 181
Dave, please take a look at the GLA output for this log, it seems to be invalid from UTF-8 perspective. See comment #7.
Marius, please attach example.xml if you still have it.

Created an attachment (id=41458)
The GLE output

Reassigning back to Marius.  I have debugged this problem to the org.eclipse.hyades.loaders.util.LoadersUtils.getMicrosecondsFromCIMFormat() method. This method is throwing 
IllegalArgumentException("Invalid parameter time stamp format.")
because partialCIMDateFormatDashDelimiter.parse(creationTime.substring(0, (tCharIndex + 9))) throws a ParseException.

GLA produces an English creationTime string like 2003-01-16T21:22:59.000000-05:00 that is passed into this method. creationTime.substring(0, (tCharIndex + 9)) produces 2003-01-16T21:22:59 which should be parsed by 
partialCIMDateFormatDashDelimiter = new SimpleDateFormat("yyyy'-'MM'-'dd'T'HH:mm:ss")

However, on the Arabic machine, the Locale is ar_EG and the SimpleDateFormat object is created with this default Locale.  This seems to be the problem. When I change partialCIMDateFormatDashDelimiter to:

partialCIMDateFormatDashDelimiter = new SimpleDateFormat("yyyy'-'MM'-'dd'T'HH:mm:ss", Locale.ENGLISH);

the creation time string is parsed successfully.  I'll attach a patch for this fix.
*** Bug 143588 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
